task.title: Easy Breakfast Tacos
task.shortdesc: These tacos include a spicy scramble and black beans topped with veggies, creamy avocado, and pomegranate arils. This recipe is simple, healthy, filling, and delicious!

ul.li: 1/2 cup salsa for serving (hot sauce also optional)

step.cmd: Wrap tofu in a clean, absorbent towel and place something heavy on top, such as a cast iron skillet, while prepping toppings.
Cook sausage/bacon in a skillet until done. Set aside.
Cook black beans in a small saucepan over medium heat until bubbly, the reduce heat to simmer and set aside. If unsalted/unseasoned, add a pinch of salt, cumin, chili powder and garlic powder.
Add dry spices and salsa to a small bowl and add enough water to make a pourable sauce. Set aside.
Heat a large skillet over medium heat and unwrap tofu. Use a fork to crumble.

Once the pan is hot, add 1-2 Tbsp oil of choice and the tofu. Stir fry for 4-5 minutes to brown. Then add seasoning and toss to coat. Continue cooking until browned and fragrant- about 5-10 minutes- stirring frequently. Set aside.
Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Once the pan is hot, add 1-2 Tbsp oil of choice and the sausage/bacon. Add seasoning and toss to coat. Continue cooking about 5-10 minutes. Set aside.

To serve, warm tortillas in the microwave wrapped in a damp paper towel or in a 250 degree oven (optional). Top tortillas with scramble, black beans, onion, avocado, cilantro, salsa, fresh lime juice, and pomegranate arils (or desired toppings).
Serve immediately with breakfast potatoes or fruit.
